title: AfriSenti: A Twitter Sentiment Analysis Benchmark for African Languages. (arXiv:2302.08956v2 [cs.CL] UPDATED)
abstract: Africa is home to over 2000 languages from over six language families and has the highest linguistic diversity among all continents. This includes 75 languages with at least one million speakers each. Yet, there is little NLP research conducted on African languages. Crucial in enabling such research is the availability of high-quality annotated datasets. In this paper, we introduce AfriSenti, which consists of 14 sentiment datasets of 110,000+ tweets in 14 African languages (Amharic, Algerian Arabic, Hausa, Igbo, Kinyarwanda, Moroccan Arabic, Mozambican Portuguese, Nigerian Pidgin, Oromo, Swahili, Tigrinya, Twi, Xitsonga, and Yor\`ub\'a) from four language families annotated by native speakers. The data is used in SemEval 2023 Task 12, the first Afro-centric SemEval shared task. translated_abstract: 非洲拥有超过2000种语言，来自六种语系，是最具语言多样性的大洲，包括75种至少有一百万说者的语言。然而，非洲语言的自然语言处理研究却很少。为了开展这样的研究，需要高质量的注释数据集。在本文中，我们介绍了 AfriSenti，它包括14种非洲语言（如阿姆哈拉语、尼日利亚皮钦语、斯瓦希里语等）的超过110,000条推文的情感数据集，并由当地说话人进行了注释。这个数据集会在2023年的 SemEval 任务12中使用，这是第一个以非洲为中心的 SemEval 共享任务。我们描述了数据收集方法、注释过程以及每个数据集在策展时面临的挑战。我们还使用不同的情感分类基准模型进行了实验，并讨论了实验结果。
tldr: AfriSenti 是一个包含14种非洲语言的情感数据集，由当地说话人进行注释，将在2023年的 SemEval 任务12中使用。
en_tdlr: AfriSenti is a sentiment dataset consisting of over 110,000 tweets in 14 African languages annotated by native speakers, and will be used in the first Afro-centric SemEval shared task in 2023.
